title.en: Biographies of Qu Yuan and Master Jia
title.raw: 《屈原賈生列傳》 Biographies of Qu Yuan and Master Jia

sentences.zh: 屈原者，名平，楚之同姓也。

translations.literal: Qu Yuan, named Ping, Chu same clan.
translations.idiomatic: Qu Yuan, named Ping, was of the same clan as Chu.

sentences.zh: 為楚懷王左徒。

translations.literal: Served Chu Huai Wang Left Tutor.
translations.idiomatic: He served as King Huai of Chu's Left Tutor.

sentences.zh: 博聞彊志，明於治亂，嫻于辭令。

translations.literal: Broad learning strong will, clear on order chaos, skilled in rhetoric.
translations.idiomatic: He had broad learning and strong will, was clear on order and chaos, skilled in rhetoric.

sentences.zh: 入則與王圖議國事，以出號令；

translations.literal: Enter then with king plan discuss state affairs, to issue commands;
translations.idiomatic: When in court, he discussed state affairs with the king and issued commands;

sentences.zh: 出則接遇賓客，應對諸侯。

translations.literal: Exit then receive guests, respond to feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: when out, he received guests and responded to feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 王甚任之。

translations.literal: King greatly relied on him.
translations.idiomatic: The king greatly relied on him.

translations.literal: Qu Yuan, named Ping, was of Chu's royal clan. He served as Chu King Huai's left aide. Broad in learning and strong in will, clear on order and chaos, skilled in rhetoric. When in court he consulted with the king on state affairs and issued commands; When abroad he received guests and responded to feudal lords. The king relied on him greatly.

sentences.zh: 上官大夫與之同列，爭寵而心害其能。

translations.literal: Shangguan Chamberlain with him same rank, competed favor yet heart resented his ability.
translations.idiomatic: The Chamberlain Shangguan was his colleague, competed for favor and resented his ability in his heart.

sentences.zh: 懷王使屈原造為憲令，屈平屬草槁未定。

translations.literal: Huai Wang made Qu Yuan draft constitutional laws, Qu Ping had just finished draft not yet decided.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai had Qu Yuan draft constitutional laws. Qu Ping had just finished the draft but it was not yet finalized.

sentences.zh: 上官大夫見而欲奪之，屈平不與，因讒之曰：「王使屈平為令，眾莫不知，每一令出，平伐其功，（曰）以為『非我莫能為』也。」

translations.literal: Shangguan Chamberlain saw and wished seize it, Qu Ping not give, therefore slandered said: 'King made Qu Ping for laws, crowd none not know, every time law out, Ping boasted merit, said 'only I can do'.'
translations.idiomatic: The Chamberlain Shangguan saw it and wanted to seize it. Qu Ping wouldn't give it to him, so he slandered him, saying: 'The king had Qu Ping make the laws. Everyone knows this. Every time a law comes out, Ping boasts of the merit, saying "Only I could do it."'

sentences.zh: 王怒而疏屈平。

translations.literal: King angered distanced Qu Ping.
translations.idiomatic: The king was angry and distanced Qu Ping.

translations.literal: The Grand Chamberlain shared his rank, competed for favor and secretly envied his talent. King Huai ordered Qu Yuan to draft the constitution. Qu Ping had just finished the rough draft. The Grand Chamberlain saw it and wanted to steal it. Qu Ping would not give it. Thus he slandered saying: 'The king ordered Qu Ping to draft the constitution. Everyone knows this. Every time a command is issued, Ping claims the credit, saying "Only I could do this."' The king grew angry and distanced Qu Ping.

sentences.zh: 屈平疾王聽之不聰也，讒諂之蔽明也，邪曲之害公也，方正之不容也，故憂愁幽思而作離騷。

translations.literal: Qu Ping grieved king listening not wise, slander flattery blocked clarity, crooked harmed justice, upright not tolerated, therefore worried sorrowful deep thought composed Li Sao.
translations.idiomatic: Qu Ping grieved that the king's listening was not wise, that slander and flattery blocked clarity, that crooked harmed justice, that upright was not tolerated. Therefore he worried and sorrowed, pondered deeply, and composed 'Li Sao'.

sentences.zh: 離騷者，猶離憂也。

translations.literal: 'Li Sao' like 'li you' (leaving sorrow).
translations.idiomatic: 'Li Sao' is like 'li you' - leaving sorrow.

sentences.zh: 夫天者，人之始也；

translations.literal: That heaven, people beginning;
translations.idiomatic: Heaven is the beginning of people;

sentences.zh: 父母者，人之本也。

translations.literal: Parents, people root.
translations.idiomatic: parents are the root of people.

sentences.zh: 人窮則反本，故勞苦倦極，未嘗不呼天也；

translations.literal: People poor then return to roots, therefore labor toil exhausted extreme, never not call heaven;
translations.idiomatic: When people are poor they return to their roots. Therefore when exhausted from labor and toil, they never fail to call on heaven;

sentences.zh: 疾痛慘怛，未嘗不呼父母也。

translations.literal: Illness pain bitter sorrow, never not call parents.
translations.idiomatic: When in illness and pain, bitter sorrow, they never fail to call on parents.

sentences.zh: 屈平正道直行，竭忠盡智以事其君，讒人閒之，可謂窮矣。

translations.literal: Qu Ping correct path straight conduct, exhausted loyalty wisdom to serve his lord, slanderers separated them, can be called poor indeed.
translations.idiomatic: Qu Ping followed the correct path and straight conduct, exhausted loyalty and wisdom to serve his lord. Slanderers came between them - can be called poor indeed.

sentences.zh: 信而見疑，忠而被謗，能無怨乎？

translations.literal: Faithful yet seen suspicious, loyal yet slandered, can have no resentment?
translations.idiomatic: Faithful yet seen as suspicious, loyal yet slandered - how could there be no resentment?

sentences.zh: 屈平之作離騷，蓋自怨生也。

translations.literal: Qu Ping composed Li Sao, probably self-resignation born.
translations.idiomatic: Qu Ping's composition of 'Li Sao' was probably born from self-resignation.

sentences.zh: 國風好色而不淫，小雅怨誹而不亂。

translations.literal: Guo Feng loves beauty not licentious, Xiao Ya resents criticizes not chaotic.
translations.idiomatic: 'Guo Feng' loves beauty but is not licentious, 'Xiao Ya' resents and criticizes but is not chaotic.

sentences.zh: 若離騷者，可謂兼之矣。

translations.literal: As for Li Sao, can be said combines them.
translations.idiomatic: As for 'Li Sao', it can be said to combine them.

sentences.zh: 上稱帝嚳，下道齊桓，中述湯武，以刺世事。

translations.literal: Above mentions Emperor Ku, below speaks Duke Huan, middle describes Tang Wu, to criticize current affairs.
translations.idiomatic: Above it mentions Emperor Ku, below speaks of Duke Huan, in the middle describes Tang and Wu, to criticize current affairs.

sentences.zh: 明道德之廣崇，治亂之條貫，靡不畢見。

translations.literal: Clarifies morality broad elevation, governance chaos systematic order, nothing not completely seen.
translations.idiomatic: It clarifies the broad elevation of morality, the systematic order of governance and chaos - nothing is not completely seen.

sentences.zh: 其文約，其辭微，其志絜，其行廉，其稱文小而其指極大，舉類邇而見義遠。

translations.literal: Its text concise, its words subtle, its will pure, its conduct clean, its references small yet its meaning extremely great, cites nearby examples yet sees far justice.
translations.idiomatic: Its text is concise, its words subtle, its will pure, its conduct clean. Its references are small but its meaning extremely great, cites nearby examples yet sees far-reaching justice.

sentences.zh: 其志絜，故其稱物芳。

translations.literal: Its will pure, therefore its named things fragrant.
translations.idiomatic: Its will is pure, therefore its named things are fragrant.

sentences.zh: 其行廉，故死而不容自疏。

translations.literal: Its conduct clean, therefore died not allowing self distant.
translations.idiomatic: Its conduct is clean, therefore died without allowing self to be distant.

sentences.zh: 濯淖汙泥之中，蟬蛻於濁穢，以浮游塵埃之外，不獲世之滋垢，皭然泥而不滓者也。

translations.literal: Washed mud filth midst, cicada molted foulness, to float roam dust outside, not obtaining world accumulated filth, pure unstained mud not dregs.
translations.idiomatic: Washed in mud and filth's midst, molted like cicada from foulness, to float and roam beyond dust, not obtaining the world's accumulated filth - pure and unstained in mud yet without dregs.

sentences.zh: 推此志也，雖與日月爭光可也。

translations.literal: Pushing this ambition, even with sun moon contend light possible.
translations.idiomatic: Pushing this ambition, even contending with sun and moon's light is possible.

translations.literal: Qu Ping resented that the king listened without wisdom, that slanderers blocked clarity, that crookedness harmed justice, that uprightness was not tolerated. Thus he worried and brooded in sorrow and composed 'Li Sao'. 'Li Sao' means departing sorrow. Heaven is the beginning of man; Parents are man's foundation. When man is in distress he returns to fundamentals, thus when exhausted by toil and weariness, one inevitably cries to heaven; When pained by illness and suffering, one inevitably cries to parents. Qu Ping walked the straight path, exhausted loyalty and wisdom serving his lord. Slanderers came between them - he can be called destitute. Trusted yet suspected, loyal yet slandered - how could he not resent? Qu Ping's composition of 'Li Sao' arose from self-pity. 'Guo Feng' delights in beauty without licentiousness, 'Xiao Ya' resents and satirizes without disorder. As for 'Li Sao', it can be said to combine both. Above it praises Emperor Ku, below it describes Duke Huan of Qi, in the middle it narrates Tang and Wu, to criticize contemporary affairs. It illuminates the vast sublimity of morality, the systematic principles of order and chaos - nothing is not fully revealed. Its text is concise, its diction subtle, its ambition pure, its conduct honest. Its language is modest but its meaning extremely grand, citing near examples yet revealing far-reaching principles. Its ambition pure, thus it praises fragrant things. Its conduct honest, thus in death it would not let itself be distant. Washing in filthy mud, shedding like a cicada from impurity, to float and roam beyond the dust, not acquiring the world's defilement, pure white mud yet unstained. Extending this ambition, even contending with sun and moon for brilliance is possible.

sentences.zh: 屈平既絀，其後秦欲伐齊，齊與楚從親，惠王患之，乃令張儀詳去秦，厚幣委質事楚，曰：「秦甚憎齊，齊與楚從親，楚誠能絕齊，秦願獻商、於之地六百里。」

translations.literal: Qu Ping already dismissed, after this Qin wished attack Qi, Qi with Chu allied closely, Hui Wang worried it, then had Zhang Yi pretend leave Qin, thick gifts humble serve Chu, said: 'Qin greatly hates Qi, Qi with Chu allied closely. Chu truly can break Qi, Qin wishes offer Shang Yu lands 600 li.'
translations.idiomatic: Qu Ping was already dismissed. After this, Qin wished to attack Qi. Qi and Chu were allied closely. King Hui worried about it, so he had Zhang Yi pretend to leave Qin, send thick gifts and humbly serve Chu, saying: 'Qin greatly hates Qi. Qi and Chu are allied closely. If Chu can truly break with Qi, Qin wishes to offer Shang and Yu lands 600 li.'

sentences.zh: 楚懷王貪而信張儀，遂絕齊，使使如秦受地。

translations.literal: Chu Huai Wang greedy believed Zhang Yi, thus broke Qi, sent envoy to Qin receive land.
translations.idiomatic: Chu's King Huai was greedy and believed Zhang Yi, thus broke with Qi, sent envoys to Qin to receive the land.

sentences.zh: 張儀詐之曰：「儀與王約六里，不聞六百里。」

translations.literal: Zhang Yi deceived them said: 'Yi with king agreed six li, not heard six hundred li.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Yi deceived them, saying: 'I agreed with the king on six li, not six hundred li.'

sentences.zh: 楚使怒去，歸告懷王。

translations.literal: Chu envoy angered left, returned told Huai Wang.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu envoy angrily left, returned and told King Huai.

sentences.zh: 懷王怒，大興師伐秦。

translations.literal: Huai Wang angered, greatly raised troops attacked Qin.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai was angry, greatly raised troops to attack Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦發兵擊之，大破楚師於丹、淅，斬首八萬，虜楚將屈丐，遂取楚之漢中地。

translations.literal: Qin sent troops struck them, greatly defeated Chu army at Dan Xi, beheaded eighty thousand, captured Chu general Qu Gai, thus took Chu Hanzhong land.
translations.idiomatic: Qin sent troops to strike them, greatly defeated the Chu army at Dan and Xi, beheaded eighty thousand, captured Chu general Qu Gai, thus took Chu's Hanzhong land.

sentences.zh: 懷王乃悉發國中兵以深入擊秦，戰於藍田。

translations.literal: Huai Wang then sent all state troops to deeply attack Qin, battled at Lantian.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai then sent all the state's troops to deeply attack Qin, battled at Lantian.

sentences.zh: 魏聞之，襲楚至鄧。

translations.literal: Wei heard it, attacked Chu to Deng.
translations.idiomatic: Wei heard of it, attacked Chu to Deng.

sentences.zh: 楚兵懼，自秦歸。

translations.literal: Chu troops feared, from Qin returned.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu troops feared, returned from Qin.

sentences.zh: 而齊竟怒不救楚，楚大困。

translations.literal: And Qi finally angered not rescued Chu, Chu greatly distressed.
translations.idiomatic: And Qi finally angered and did not rescue Chu, Chu was greatly distressed.

translations.literal: Qu Ping having been demoted, afterward Qin wanted to attack Qi. Qi and Chu had allied closely. Qin King Hui worried, thus ordered Zhang Yi to pretend to leave Qin, offer rich gifts and serve Chu, saying: 'Qin greatly hates Qi. Qi and Chu have allied closely. If Chu can truly break with Qi, Qin wishes to offer the lands of Shang and Yu, six hundred li.' Chu King Huai, greedy, believed Zhang Yi, thus broke with Qi and sent envoys to Qin to receive land. Zhang Yi deceived saying: 'Yi and the king agreed to six li, not six hundred li.' The Chu envoy angrily left, returned and reported to King Huai. King Huai angered, greatly raised troops to attack Qin. Qin sent troops to strike them, greatly defeated Chu army at Dan and Xi, beheaded eighty thousand, captured Chu general Qu Gai, thus took Chu's Han River region. King Huai then mobilized all troops in the state for deep invasion to attack Qin, battled at Lan Tian. Wei heard of it, raided Chu to Deng. Chu troops feared, returned from Qin. Yet Qi ultimately angered and did not rescue Chu, Chu greatly distressed.

sentences.zh: 明年，秦割漢中地與楚以和。

translations.literal: Next year, Qin ceded Hanzhong land to Chu for peace.
translations.idiomatic: Next year, Qin ceded Hanzhong land to Chu for peace.

sentences.zh: 楚王曰：「不願得地，願得張儀而甘心焉。」

translations.literal: Chu Wang said: 'Not wish get land, wish get Zhang Yi satisfy hatred.'
translations.idiomatic: The Chu king said: 'Do not wish to get the land, wish to get Zhang Yi and satisfy our hatred.'

sentences.zh: 張儀聞，乃曰：「以一儀而當漢中地，臣請往如楚。」

translations.literal: Zhang Yi heard, then said: 'With one Zhang Yi match Hanzhong land, minister requests go to Chu.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Yi heard, then said: 'With one Zhang Yi to match Hanzhong land, I request to go to Chu.'

sentences.zh: 如楚，又因厚幣用事者臣靳尚，而設詭辯於懷王之寵姬鄭袖。

translations.literal: Went to Chu, moreover used thick gifts influential minister Jin Shang, set up deceptive arguments with Huai Wang favored concubine Zheng Xiu.
translations.idiomatic: He went to Chu, moreover used thick gifts on influential minister Jin Shang, and set up deceptive arguments with King Huai's favored concubine Zheng Xiu.

sentences.zh: 懷王竟聽鄭袖，復釋去張儀。

translations.literal: Huai Wang finally listened Zheng Xiu, again released Zhang Yi.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai finally listened to Zheng Xiu, again released Zhang Yi.

sentences.zh: 是時屈平既疏，不復在位，使於齊，顧反，諫懷王曰：「何不殺張儀？」

translations.literal: This time Qu Ping already alienated, no longer in position, sent to Qi, looked back, advised Huai Wang said: 'Why not kill Zhang Yi?'
translations.idiomatic: At this time Qu Ping was already alienated, no longer in position. Sent to Qi, he looked back and advised King Huai, saying: 'Why not kill Zhang Yi?'

sentences.zh: 懷王悔，追張儀不及。

translations.literal: Huai Wang regretted, pursued Zhang Yi could not catch.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai regretted, pursued Zhang Yi but could not catch him.

translations.literal: Next year, Qin ceded Han River region to Chu for peace. Chu king said: 'I do not wish land, I wish Zhang Yi to satisfy my hatred.' Zhang Yi heard, thus said: 'Using one Yi to exchange for Han River region, minister requests to go to Chu.' Went to Chu, again used rich gifts to make the influential minister Jin Shang serve him, and set deceptive arguments through King Huai's favored concubine Zheng Xiu. King Huai ultimately listened to Zheng Xiu, again released Zhang Yi. At this time Qu Ping was already estranged, no longer in position. Sent to Qi, on return advised King Huai: 'Why not kill Zhang Yi?' King Huai regretted, pursued Zhang Yi but could not catch him.

sentences.zh: 其後諸侯共擊楚，大破之，殺其將唐眛。

translations.literal: After this feudal lords together attacked Chu, greatly defeated them, killed their general Tang Mei.
translations.idiomatic: After this, the feudal lords together attacked Chu, greatly defeated them, and killed their general Tang Mei.

translations.literal: Afterward the feudal lords together attacked Chu, greatly defeated them, killed their general Tang Mei.

sentences.zh: 時秦昭王與楚婚，欲與懷王會。

translations.literal: At this time Qin Zhao Wang married with Chu, wished to meet with Huai Wang.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Qin's King Zhao married with Chu and wished to meet with King Huai.

sentences.zh: 懷王欲行，屈平曰：「秦虎狼之國，不可信，不如毋行。」

translations.literal: Huai Wang wished go, Qu Ping said: 'Qin tiger wolf country, cannot trust, better not go.'
translations.idiomatic: King Huai wished to go. Qu Ping said: 'Qin is a tiger and wolf country that cannot be trusted. It would be better not to go.'

sentences.zh: 懷王稚子子蘭勸王行：「柰何絕秦歡！」

translations.literal: Huai Wang young son Zi Lan advised king go: 'How break Qin friendship!'
translations.idiomatic: King Huai's young son Zi Lan advised the king to go: 'How can we break off Qin's friendship!'

sentences.zh: 懷王卒行。

translations.literal: Huai Wang finally went.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai finally went.

sentences.zh: 入武關，秦伏兵絕其後，因留懷王，以求割地。

translations.literal: Entered Wuguan, Qin ambush troops cut off their rear, thus detained Huai Wang to demand ceding land.
translations.idiomatic: They entered Wuguan. Qin ambush troops cut off their rear, thus detaining King Huai to demand the ceding of land.

sentences.zh: 懷王怒，不聽。

translations.literal: Huai Wang angered, did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai was angry and did not listen.

sentences.zh: 亡走趙，趙不內。

translations.literal: Fled to Zhao, Zhao not admit.
translations.idiomatic: He fled to Zhao, but Zhao would not admit him.

sentences.zh: 復之秦，竟死於秦而歸葬。

translations.literal: Returned to Qin, finally died in Qin returned for burial.
translations.idiomatic: He returned to Qin and finally died there, his body returned for burial.

translations.literal: At this time Qin King Zhao married into Chu, wished to meet with King Huai. King Huai wished to go. Qu Ping said: 'Qin is a tiger wolf state, cannot be trusted, better not to go.' King Huai's young son Zi Lan urged the king to go: 'How can we cut off Qin's goodwill!' King Huai ultimately went. Entered Wu Pass, Qin ambushed troops cut off his rear, thus detained King Huai to demand territory cession. King Huai angered, would not listen. Fled to Zhao, Zhao would not admit him. Returned to Qin, ultimately died in Qin and was returned for burial.

sentences.zh: 長子頃襄王立，以其弟子蘭為令尹。

translations.literal: Eldest son King Qingxiang established, made his younger brother Zi Lan prime minister.
translations.idiomatic: His eldest son, King Qingxiang, was established on the throne, and he made his younger brother Zi Lan prime minister.

sentences.zh: 楚人既咎子蘭以勸懷王入秦而不反也。

translations.literal: Chu people already blamed Zi Lan for advising Huai Wang enter Qin not return.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu people already blamed Zi Lan for advising King Huai to enter Qin and not return.

translations.literal: Eldest son King Qingxiang ascended, made his younger brother Zi Lan prime minister. Chu people already blamed Zi Lan for urging King Huai to enter Qin without return.

sentences.zh: 屈平既嫉之，雖放流，睠顧楚國，系心懷王，不忘欲反，冀幸君之一悟，俗之一改也。

translations.literal: Qu Ping already hated him, though banished, fondly regarded Chu state, tied heart Huai Wang, not forget wished return, hoped king one awakening, customs one change.
translations.idiomatic: Qu Ping already hated Zi Lan. Though banished, he fondly regarded the Chu state, tied his heart to King Huai, did not forget his wish to return, hoping for the king's one awakening and the customs' one change.

sentences.zh: 其存君興國而欲反覆之，一篇之中三致志焉。

translations.literal: His preserve lord revive country wish reverse it, one chapter three times expressed will.
translations.idiomatic: His desire to preserve the lord and revive the country and reverse their situation is expressed three times in this one chapter.

sentences.zh: 然終無可柰何，故不可以反，卒以此見懷王之終不悟也。

translations.literal: Yet finally nothing could be done, therefore could not return, finally thus saw Huai Wang final lack of awakening.
translations.idiomatic: Yet finally there was nothing that could be done, therefore he could not return. He finally thus saw King Huai's final lack of awakening.

sentences.zh: 人君無愚智賢不肖，莫不欲求忠以自為，舉賢以自佐，然亡國破家相隨屬，而聖君治國累世而不見者，其所謂忠者不忠，而所謂賢者不賢也。

translations.literal: Rulers regardless foolish wise worthy unworthy, none not wish seek loyal for themselves, raise worthy assist themselves, yet ruined states broken families follow succession, yet sage kings govern states generations not appear - what they called loyal not loyal, what they called worthy not worthy.
translations.idiomatic: Rulers, regardless of foolish or wise, worthy or unworthy, none do not wish to seek loyal ministers for themselves and raise worthy ones to assist them. Yet ruined states and broken families follow in succession, while sage kings who govern states for generations do not appear - what they call loyal is not loyal, what they call worthy is not worthy.

sentences.zh: 懷王以不知忠臣之分，故內惑於鄭袖，外欺於張儀，疏屈平而信上官大夫、令尹子蘭。

translations.literal: Huai Wang because not know loyal ministers distinction, therefore internally confused by Zheng Xiu, externally deceived by Zhang Yi, alienated Qu Ping trusted Chamberlain Shangguan, Prime Minister Zi Lan.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai, because he did not know the distinction of loyal ministers, was therefore internally confused by Zheng Xiu, externally deceived by Zhang Yi, alienated Qu Ping and trusted Chamberlain Shangguan and Prime Minister Zi Lan.

sentences.zh: 兵挫地削，亡其六郡，身客死於秦，為天下笑。

translations.literal: Army defeated land reduced, lost six commanderies, body died as guest in Qin, became world laughingstock.
translations.idiomatic: His army was defeated and land reduced, he lost six commanderies, his body died as a guest in Qin, and he became the world's laughingstock.

sentences.zh: 此不知人之禍也。

translations.literal: This not know people calamity.
translations.idiomatic: This is the calamity of not knowing people.

sentences.zh: 《易》曰：「井泄不食，為我心惻，可以汲。

translations.literal: 'Yi Jing' said: 'Well leaks not drunk, makes my heart sorrowful, can draw water.
translations.idiomatic: The 'Yi Jing' says: 'Well leaks but is not drunk from, makes my heart sorrowful, can draw water.

sentences.zh: 王明，并受其福。」

translations.literal: King enlightened, all receive its blessing.'
translations.idiomatic: King enlightened, all receive its blessing.'

sentences.zh: 王之不明，豈足福哉！

translations.literal: King lack of enlightenment, how sufficient blessing!
translations.idiomatic: The king's lack of enlightenment - how sufficient for blessing!

translations.literal: Qu Ping having envied this, though banished, gazed back at Chu state, heart attached to King Huai, not forgetting desire to return, hoping the lord would one day awaken, customs would one day change. His preserving the lord and reviving the state while wishing to overturn them - in one poem three times expressing this ambition. Yet ultimately nothing could be done, thus could not return, finally showed King Huai's final lack of awakening. Rulers, whether foolish or wise, worthy or unworthy, all wish to seek loyalty for themselves, promote worthies to assist themselves. Yet ruined states and broken families follow one after another, while sage lords govern states for generations without being seen. What they call loyal is not loyal, what they call worthy is not worthy. King Huai because he did not know the distinction of loyal ministers, thus internally deluded by Zheng Xiu, externally deceived by Zhang Yi, distanced Qu Ping while trusting Grand Chamberlain and Prime Minister Zi Lan. sentences.zh: 賈生數上疏，言諸侯或連數郡，非古之制，可稍削之。

translations.literal: Jia Sheng several times submit memorials, speak marquises some connect several commanderies, not ancient system, can gradually reduce them.
translations.idiomatic: Jia Sheng several times submitted memorials, saying that some marquises connected several commanderies, which was not the ancient system, and they could gradually be reduced.

sentences.zh: 文帝不聽。

translations.literal: Wen Emperor not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wen did not listen.

translations.literal: Wen emperor again enfeoffed Huainan Li Wang sons four people all as marquises. Jia Sheng advised, considered calamity rise from this. Jia Sheng several times submitted memorials, spoke various marquises connected several commanderies, not ancient system, can gradually reduce them. Wen emperor not listened.

sentences.zh: 居數年，懷王騎，墮馬而死，無後。

translations.literal: Dwell several years, Huai King ride horse, fall horse die, no posterity.
translations.idiomatic: After several years, King Huai was riding a horse, fell from the horse and died, leaving no posterity.

sentences.zh: 賈生自傷為傅無狀，哭泣歲餘，亦死。

translations.literal: Jia Sheng self blame as tutor without achievement, cry weep year plus, also die.
translations.idiomatic: Jia Sheng blamed himself for being an unsuccessful tutor, wept for more than a year, and also died.

sentences.zh: 賈生之死時年三十三矣。

translations.literal: Jia Sheng death time age thirty three.
translations.idiomatic: At the time of Jia Sheng's death, he was thirty-three years old.

sentences.zh: 及孝文崩，孝武皇帝立，舉賈生之孫二人至郡守，而賈嘉最好學，世其家，與余通書。

translations.literal: When Filial Wen passed, Filial Wu Emperor established, raise Jia Sheng two grandsons to commandery governors, Jia Jia most good learning, inherit family, with me communicate writings.
translations.idiomatic: When Emperor Wen passed away and Emperor Wu ascended the throne, he raised two of Jia Sheng's grandsons to the position of commandery governors. Jia Jia was the most studious and inherited the family tradition, communicating with me through writings.

sentences.zh: 至孝昭時，列為九卿。

translations.literal: To Filial Zhao time, listed as nine ministers.
translations.idiomatic: During Emperor Zhao's reign, he was listed among the nine ministers.

translations.literal: Dwelt several years, Huai Wang rode, fell horse died, no posterity. Jia Sheng self-injured as tutor without achievement, wept year plus, also died. Jia Sheng death time age thirty-three. When Filial Wen collapsed, Filial Wu emperor ascended, promoted Jia Sheng grandsons two to commandery governors, Jia Jia most liked learning, inherited family, with me exchanged letters. To Filial Zhao time, listed as nine ministers.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：余讀離騷、天問、招魂、哀郢，悲其志。

translations.literal: Grand Historian said: I read Li Sao, Tian Wen, Zhao Hun, Ai Ying, grieve his ambition.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian said: I have read 'Li Sao', 'Tian Wen', 'Zhao Hun', and 'Ai Ying', and grieve for his ambition.

sentences.zh: 適長沙，觀屈原所自沈淵，未嘗不垂涕，想見其為人。

translations.literal: Went Changsha, view Qu Yuan where self drowned abyss, never not shed tears, imagine see his person.
translations.idiomatic: When I went to Changsha and viewed the abyss where Qu Yuan drowned himself, I never failed to shed tears, imagining I could see his character.

sentences.zh: 及見賈生弔之，又怪屈原以彼其材，游諸侯，何國不容，而自令若是。

translations.literal: When see Jia Sheng lament him, again strange Qu Yuan with his talent, travel various lords, what country not contain, yet self make like this.
translations.idiomatic: When I saw Jia Sheng's lament for him, I was again puzzled that Qu Yuan, with his talent, traveling among the various lords, would not be contained by any country, yet made himself like this.

sentences.zh: 讀服烏賦，同死生，輕去就，又爽然自失矣。

translations.literal: Read Fu Ou assignment, same death life, light leave take, again clearly self lost.
translations.idiomatic: When I read the 'Fu on the Owl', treating death and life as the same, lightly regarding leaving and taking, I was again clearly lost in self-reflection.

translations.literal: Grand Historian says: I read 'Li Sao', 'Tian Wen', 'Zhao Hun', 'Ai Ying', sorrowful his ambition. Passed Changsha, viewed Qu Yuan self-drowned abyss, never not shed tears, imagined saw his person. When saw Jia Sheng mourn him, again strange Qu Yuan with his talent, traveled feudal lords, what state not contain, yet self made like this. Read 'Fu Niao' rhapsody, same death life, light depart stay, again clearly self-lost.
